1.Task: What’s the best programming language, in your opinion? Justify your answer
1.Solution: This is a very hard question to answer. All programming languages have their advantages and disadvantages. For example Haskell programs have far fewer bugs, but are (arguably) harder to learn. C is easier to learn but still slower to develop in once learned. C++ I would argue is an excellent language. The syntax is clear and easy to learn, it is fast, stable, popular and is compiled not interpreted.

2.Task: Suppose you are part of a team of developers about to start programming a Web-based cinema ticket booking system (to be used over the Internet). What programming language would you suggest for this? Give 2 reasons to support your suggestion.
2.Solution: I would suggest PHP because it is stable. Built for the web. And has many built in functions without the need for plugins (unlike ruby)

3.Task: How can you measure the efficiency of a program? Is efficiency the most important feature of a program? Justify your answer.
3.Solution: You can measure the efficiency of a program by how fast the program runs and whether or not it does unnecessary tasks. Efficiency is important but, depending on the project the developers time can be considered more important. Thus, spending extra time to increase the efficiency of a program may not be worth the cost

6.Task: Do you agree with the statement “Fortran is a dead programming language”? Justify your answer.
6.Solution: No I do not. Fortran is still used in  numerical computing, particularly by scientists and engineers in physics, meteorology and other number-intensive fields.

7.Task: What was the “millennium bug” and how did it create a sudden and very high demand for COBOL programmers?
7.Solution: The millennium bug is a set of problems which arose in the year 2000 because programmers would encode years with only the last 2 digits of the year (i.e. 95 instead of 1995) This causes many issues because legacy programs for example may mistakenly think its 1917 instead of 2017.

8.Task: Java is a very popular programming language. What was it originally designed for and what was the main feature that made it popular?
8.Solution: Java was originally intended to be used for electronics like washing machines, cars etc. It is popular because you can write code once and run it on multiple platforms

9.Task: Which one is the “best”: Java or LUA? Justify your answer.
